title: Final Exam Schedule Released
content: The final exam schedule for Fall 2024 semester has been published. Please check your student portal for specific dates and times. Exams will begin on December 16th and continue through December 22nd. Make sure to review the academic calendar for any updates.
author: Academic Affairs Office

title: CS-401: Office Hours Extended
content: Due to the upcoming assignment deadline, I will be extending office hours this week. Available Monday and Wednesday 3-5 PM in addition to regular Tuesday 2-4 PM slot. Please bring specific questions about your dynamic programming implementation.
author: Dr. Sarah Chen

title: Campus Library Holiday Hours
content: The campus library will have modified hours during the winter break. December 23-January 2: Closed. January 3-7: 9 AM - 6 PM. Regular hours resume January 8th. Digital resources remain available 24/7 through the online portal.
author: Library Services

title: Emergency: Campus Water Outage
content: Due to a main water line break, water service will be interrupted in the Engineering and Science buildings today from 2 PM - 6 PM. Classes scheduled in these buildings will be moved to alternate locations. Check email for specific room changes.
author: Facilities Management

title: Spring Registration Reminder
content: Spring 2025 registration continues through December 15th. Seniors register December 5-8, Juniors December 9-11, Sophomores December 12-13, Freshmen December 14-15. Meet with your advisor before registering to discuss course planning.
author: Registrar's Office

title: Winter Career Fair
content: Join us for the Winter Career Fair on December 10th from 10 AM - 4 PM in the Student Union Ballroom. Over 75 companies will be recruiting for internships and full-time positions. Bring multiple copies of your resume and dress professionally.
author: Career Services

title: MATH-301: Study Group Formation
content: Several students have expressed interest in forming study groups for the final exam. I encourage this collaborative approach. Please use the course discussion board to coordinate groups. Remember, the exam covers chapters 8-12 with emphasis on eigenvalues and linear transformations.
author: Dr. Michael Rodriguez
